description:
net/proxy: new package.

net/proxy provides client support for tunneling connections through
various proxies.

This is an initial, incomplete sketch of the code to lay down an
API. It's quite possible that we don't want the code at all.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

I agree that it is too late for a new standard package.
I'd be happy to see this in exp/proxy though.
I think it has some chance of helping http in the long run.

Russ

>
> It's probably a bit too late to be adding new packages to the tree
> given that Go 1 is just around the corner. Personally, I'd go with a
> separate repo for this; that doesn't preclude it migrating in to the
> standard library in the future. If people do want this in the standard
> repo right now, exp/net/proxy would probably be a better landing
> place.


FWIW, I think it's worth being in the standard repo if for no other reason
than it may allow http.Client to do the right thing in the presence of
environmentally specified proxies; I also think it's worthwhile for any
client/server type programming, though, as there are a lot of environments
in which a proxy is required to get in or out.

It's probably a bit too late to be adding new packages to the tree
given that Go 1 is just around the corner. Personally, I'd go with a
separate repo for this; that doesn't preclude it migrating in to the
standard library in the future. If people do want this in the standard
repo right now, exp/net/proxy would probably be a better landing
place.


Dave.

subject: code review 5484063: net/proxy: new package.
